name: Simplelocalizedandroidapp
body:
------------------------------------ SimpleLocalizedAndroidApp v1.0 ------------------------------------ WTFPL - Do What The Fuck You Want To Public License xD
Original Coder : @geniustd | [Ref [Blog-Post]](http://tharindudassanayake.wordpress.com/2012/02/25/use-sinhala-fonts-for-your-android-app)
Modified By : @harshadura
Last Modified : 03-03-2012
------------------------------------ Few Notes ------------------------------------ * You can use [UCSC Converter](http://www.ucsc.cmb.ac.lk/ltrl/services/feconverter/?maps=s_dlm-u.xml) to convert unicode font into ttf related codes which are using in the xml view. ex: "wessa" > jeiai "jeiai" is the text you have to put into xml, that will result in "wessa" as output. * You can use any Sinhala unicode supported font instead of using "amal.ttf" font. (in case if you dont like that font style) * No need of Tamil fonts cause Tamil unicode is already consist with Android. (South indians developers might rocking huh!) Cheers! happy Coding! Regards, @harshadura
tagline: Sinhala, Tamil localization for Android Apps
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
